history.content:
Yes you can retake it (as long as you receive a NP) and have the new grade counted towards the GPA requirement. Be aware that repeating courses to get higher grades is strongly discouraged under the admissions policy to the major. You may only retake a particular prerequisite once with the repeated grade being final, and can only retake a maximum of 12 units.

You can also take it for a letter grade and if you end up getting a D+ or lower it will be counted as a fail, and once you retake the class for a letter grade the new gpa will overwrite the old gpa.

Yes you can retake it (as long as you receive a NP) and have the new grade counted towards the GPA requirement. Be aware that repeating courses to get higher grades is strongly discouraged under the admissions policy to the major. You may only retake a particular prerequisite once with the repeated grade being final, and can only retake a maximum of 12 units.

If I'm trying to meet the minimum prerequisite GPA requirement, but I know I will fail a prerequisite like CS 61A, 61B, or 70, can I change the grading option to P/NP (and then receive a NP) and retake the class for a letter grade? Like will the grade I get the second time be counted toward the GPA requirement?
history.subject: P/NP a prereq
